attributes.action: permit British hauliers to install Statute Mile tachographs and bring HGV instrumentation back into line with the British road system.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British hauliers have for decades been compelled to record all routes taken by heavy goods vehicles in kilometres.

The drivers must read a speedometer with Kilometres per hour writ large, and therefore dominant, but with Miles per hour printed on a much smaller radius and therefore diminutive, making MPH much less easy to read.

As there are no plans to metricate our road system, and given that such would be universally unpopular, I think it is time to put the Mile back into our transport fleet.

I have never yet heard a driver express speed or journey in terms of kilometres.
